item.title: Operation Heart Blocker: Disruption action deals blow to criminal cyber network HeartSender
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: During a disruption action on January 29, 2025, HeartSender servers and domains were seized by various police services. HeartSender is the name of a group of phishing software makers. The Cybercrime Team of the East Brabant police unit started an investigation at the end of 2022, after phishing software was found on the computer of...

item.title: Almost one year later, NorthBay Health notifies 569,012 people of breach of sensitive information
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: While some states are decreasing the amount of time entities have to notify the state or individuals of a breach, the reality is that many entities are nowhere near complying with even more lenient deadlines. HIPAA, for example, allows entities no more than 60 calendar days from discovery of a breach (the first day they...

item.title: Heart Centre Cyberattack in Australia, DragonForce Claims Responsibility for Sensitive Data Theft
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: SuspectFile reports: The healthcare sector continues to be a prime target for cybercriminal groups, with targeted attacks putting patient safety and medical information confidentiality at risk. The recent attack on Heart Centre, a network of cardiology clinics located in New South Wales, Australia, carried out by the DragonForce group, once again highlights the vulnerability of hospital IT...

item.title: Backdoor found in two healthcare patient monitors, linked to IP in China
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Lawrence Abrams reports: The US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is warning that Contec CMS8000 devices, a widely used healthcare patient monitoring device, include a backdoor that quietly sends patient data to a remote IP address and downloads and executes files on the device. Contec is a China-based company that specializes in healthcare technology, offering...

item.title: Law enforcement continues efforts to disrupt cybercrime forums and services
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Law enforcement has been busy. As reported yesterday, Cracked and Nulled forums were seized along with services associated with them financially. Two suspects were arrested in Spain. Today, DOJ issued two press releases. The first was about yesterday’s seizures: Cracked and Nulled Marketplaces Disrupted in International Cyber Operation The Justice Department today announced its participation...

item.title: Exclusive: Apex Custom Software hacked, threat actors threaten to leak the software
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: On January 20, the hackers known as 0mid16B tweeted, “At 7:40AM 20th Jan (US time), a US healthcare software provider has been hacked. All data in server has been deleted. 48 hours left before we publish all data.” The attached screenshot showed a listing of medications, but without any patient information attached. Two days later,...

item.title: No need to hack when it’s leaking: ZAR clinics edition
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Heise.de reports: A massive data leak potentially affects hundreds of thousands of patients at ZAR rehab clinics across Germany. Among other things, highly sensitive medical reports were accessible. The affected rehab centers are under the umbrella of Nanz medico, which claims to be the largest provider of outpatient rehab services in Germany. This includes a...

item.title: New York Blood Center Enterprises Ransomware Attack Update
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: A personal message to whatever threat actor or ransomware group hit the New York Blood Center: You are endangering lives, and every day that goes by will put more lives at risk. Do the morally right thing and give them a decryptor now. — Dissent. A statement from the New York Blood Center: January 29:...

item.title: FBI seizes Cracked.io, Nulled.to hacking forums in Operation Talent (1)
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: Sergiu Gatlan reports: Update January 29, 14:15 EST: Seizure banners were added to the cracked[.] io, nulled [.] to, starkrdp [.] io, mysellix [.] io, and sellix [.] io, confirming that the domains had been seized in a joint law enforcement action dubbed “Operation Talent” that included authorities from the United States, Italy, Spain, Europe,...

item.title: With his criminal trial looming, the hacker known as “DR32” pleaded guilty in federal court
item.dc:creator: Dissent
item.description: With only two weeks until his trial was scheduled to start, Australian national David Kee Crees informed a federal court in Colorado that he wanted to change his plea to guilty. On January 15, he pleaded guilty to 14 out of 22 counts. Background Crees, a 26 year-old Australian, was known online as Abdilo, DR32,...
